articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Resurgent Russian forces, which outnumber and outgun the Ukrainians, have mounted multiple attacks on the eastern front.
articles.title: Ukraine struggles to hold eastern front as Russians advance on cities

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Hamas fighters in the narrow alleyways of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Friday in some of the fiercest engagements since they returned to the area a week ago, while in the south militants attacked tanks massing around Rafah.
articles.title: Fierce fighting in northern Gaza as Israel defends itself at World Court

articles.author: Tom Sims
articles.description: German police arrested eight climate activists who breached the grounds of Munich airport on Saturday, briefly causing the airport to close and leading to around 60 flight cancellations during a busy holiday weekend.
articles.title: Eight arrested after climate activists breach German airport

articles.author: Arshad Mohammed
articles.description: White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan will visit Saudi Arabia this weekend for talks expected to touch on a civil nuclear cooperation agreement, one piece of a wider arrangement Washington hopes will lead to normalization of Israeli-Saudi relations.
articles.title: US-Saudi nuclear deal: how might it work?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Unrest in France's Pacific island territory has caused the deaths of at least six people.
articles.title: Australians stranded in New Caledonia 'running out of food' amid civil unrest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three foreign tourists and one Afghan citizen were killed by gunmen in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province on Friday, the interior ministry said.
articles.title: Gunmen kill three foreign tourists in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of protesters in Peru's capital marched on Friday to demand the scrapping of a new law that describes transgender people, among others, as having a mental illness so they can access health benefits.
articles.title: Peru protesters slam new insurance law that deems transgender people mentally ill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Libya's eastern-based authorities are investigating the disappearance of a member of parliament, the region's interior ministry said, and it did not believe he had been killed.
articles.title: Libya's eastern government investigating disappearance of lawmaker

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The condition of Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico has stabilised but remains serious, the country's health minister said on Saturday, following Wednesday's assassination attempt against the central European leader.
articles.title: Slovak Prime Minister Fico stable but in serious condition

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France accused Azerbaijan on Friday of fanning the flames of riots in the French-ruled Pacific island of New Caledonia by flooding social media with what it said were misleading photos and videos targeting French police.
articles.title: France accuses Azerbaijan of meddling in New Caledonia with social media campaign
